title: >>> SERIES Premier?
body_text:
Those in attendance at DODGEBALL LX3 are likely never to forget the events that transpired. What a competitive, yet fun and thrilling atmosphere from beginning to end. Five against 13, a winner-take-all tournament, and so much more truly brought dodgeball to a new level of competition even if for one night only.
The Series Premier?
The 64th installment comes this Saturday night, November 18. The
Revival Tour
, though off to a shaky start, may have hit its true starting point with LX3. Was it the beginning of a brand new chapter?
It is known that with the Thanksgiving holiday approaching, many past legends will likely be making their long-awaited returns to the dodgeball courts. Main eventers like Ryan Letsche, Kurt Gassner, Sara DeCuir, among others, have showcased their talents on the biggest stages of dodgeball. Around this time last year, athletes of their caliber were making headlines in the dodgeball community. DODGEBALL 13, DODGEBALL XIV, and DODGEBALL 15 were easily three of the most memorable nights in the history of the sport, setting the stage for what would become, arguably, the biggest event of them all, DODGEBALL 20.
One year later, new names have stepped into the forefront of dodgeball's elite. But the veterans of the past are never to be neglected or disrespected as it was they who paved the way for the unforgettable journey known as dodgeball.
Will the dodgeball world see any of its past icons compete in the next November event? Find out for yourself and experience DODGEBALL LXIV live!
Pond Scum: Part 2?
Pond Scum unquestionably left their mark forever when weeks of harrassment and threats culminated at the spectacle known as DODGEBALL LX3. Come gametime, they put their money where their mouth was despite a huge disadvantage, and fought like the true champions that they are.
So having to follow the brutal confrontation of LX3 will certainly be no easy task. It is rumored, yet unconfirmed, that several Pond Scum members will be returning once again this coming weekend at DODGEBALL LXIV. What will the green machines have up their sleeves this week? And will they be able to outdo themselves following LX3?
